definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: A draft upon my neighbour was to me the same as money.
sentences.chinese: 我以为用支票向邻居支款，同现钱一样。

sentences.english: The company is short of cash at the moment.
He offered to work out the debt, but I needed the money more.
sentences.chinese: 他提出做工来抵债，可是我更需要现钱。

sentences.english: The guy had a reputation for selling good acid so I happily gave him my cash.
sentences.chinese: 那家伙卖好酸是出了名的，我很痛快地把现钱给了他。

sentences.english: You know he'll try to hit us up for cash.
sentences.chinese: 你是知道的，他会试着向我们要现钱。

sentences.english: This time I have cash. Give me the good wine.
I haven't got any cash. Can you change a fifty-dollar traveler's check?
sentences.chinese: 我没有现钱，您能找开一张五十元的旅行支票吗？

definition: silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to scatter money/to give to charity
small sum of money/loose change/Cantonese equivalent of 零錢|零钱[ling2 qian2]
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
